description:
For more than a century, scientists have used model organisms to address
questions in biology. An explosion of recent research has given us the tools
to use dogs and other canids as model organisms. In this course we study the
genetics and genomics, evolution, ecology, and behaviour of dogs, and use
dogs as a “stepping‐off” point to examine other topics in the life sciences. As a class we will formulate and address hypotheses using a variety of
laboratory and field techniques.
title: Dogs as Model Organisms
